description: Sequence A001033 gives the numbers n such that the sum of the squares of n consecutive odd numbers x^2 + (x+2)^2 + ... +(x+2n-2)^2 = k^2 for some integer k. For each n, this sequence gives the least value of x.
links: T. D. Noe and Christopher E. Thompson, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..101
example: 995 is a term because the sum of the squares of 400 consecutive odd numbers beginning with 995 is 28260^2.
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 04 2000
extensions: Corrected and extended by _T. D. Noe_, Oct 24 2007
Term corresponding to 1024 in A001033 was missing from b-file. _Christopher E. Thompson_, Feb 05 2016
